hero.title: These Filipinos paid thousands for a job in Poland. Now they feel cheated
hero.description: (One of) Two-part Al Jazeera investigation reveals claims of deception by recruiters working across multiple countries.

primary.lead: United Nations Rapporteur Irene Khan Arrival in Manila
primary.title: Special Rapporteur Khan arrives, starts 12-day tour of PH - Manila Standard
primary.description: United Nations Special Rapporteur (UNSR) on Freedom of Opinion and Expression Irene Khan arrived in Manila for a 12-day visit on the invitation of the Philippine government. Khan landed at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) Terminal 1 onboard flight MH806 from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia around 12:30 p.m. Monday, Jan. 22.

secondary.title: Dela Rosa tells Marcos: Be man enough. Tell us if you allowed ICC to enter PH.
secondary.description: 'Please Tell Us What Is The Real Score', says Senator Bato dela Rosa

secondary.title: Marcos: Philippines ‘will not lift a finger’ to help ICC drug-war probe
secondary.description: International Criminal Court investigators can enter the country but government officials will keep an eye on them, president says.

secondary.title: UN rapporteur visits 3 red-tagged political prisoners in Tacloban
secondary.description: Human rights group Karapatan lauded the United Nations (UN) expert on freedom of expression for visiting a progressive journalist and two activists currently behind bars at the Tacloban City Jail this Saturday.

carousel.title: Filipinos in Hong Kong were promised a new life in Poland. It never came
carousel.description: (Two of) Two-part Al Jazeera investigation reveals claims of deception by recruiters working across multiple countries.

carousel.title: 9 suspects in Marawi bombing killed in clash with soldiers
carousel.description: Nine alleged terrorists tagged as suspects in the December 2023 bombing in the Mindanao State University in Marawi were killed by troops in Lanao del Sur, the Philippine Army reported.

carousel.title: Philippines, Vietnam to sign coastguard deal risking China's ire
carousel.description: The Philippines and Vietnam will agree to boost coastguard cooperation during a visit to Hanoi next week by Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr, officials said, a move that risks angering China.

carousel.title: CNN Philippines shutting down as losses exceed P5B
carousel.description: Manila — CNN Philippines is going off the air nearly nine years after debuting into the local broadcasting industry as its local franchise holder decided to pull the plug after accumulating
